name: Studies in Contemporary American Fiction
description: Developments in American fiction from the end of the 1950s to the present. A study of fiction from the period that produced James Baldwin, Saul Bellow, Philip Roth, John Updike, Norman Mailer, Ann Beatty, Raymond Carver, Don DeLillo, Toni Morrison, Maxine Hong Kingston, and Leslie Marmon Silko. The course may be organized around themes or movements.
prerequisites: [ENGB03H3 & ENGB04H3 & one of ENGB05H3 or (ENGB01H3)] or [ENGB08H3 & ENGB09H3]
